Fields.DialogueText: We've got Morganas coming out to play!
@BATTLE
The enemy has been taken care of, Kanchou. Not a single ship on the horizon.
Not a one? Are you sure?
Of course I'm sure. But if you don't believe me, you can always borrow my binoculars and check for yourself.

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, no, I remember what happened last time I used your binoculars.
That's okay. I trust your instincts, Kitakami.
Much appreciated.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, relax. I learned my lesson last time. You're not a fan of those kinds of jokes.
That means a lot. Thanks!
Look at that! I figured you'd still be a little hesitant to use anything of mine after last time.
All right. We might actually have some time to catch our breath.
If you've got some free time, then I've got the perfect idea for how you should spend it.
Perfect idea, huh? Perfect for me or for you?
For both of us! I just wanted to share some of the poetry I've been reading with you. We agreed to read it together, remember?
That's not quite how I remember it. Maybe later, I've got some important captain stuff to do.
Sounds like an excuse.
*ALARM*
Let me try writing a poem. In English, no less! "Morganas coming through the sea, Morganas are no match for me!"
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Take a seat - it's poetry time! I've got some modern English-language stuff we really need to get into!
You do realize I was already in the middle of taking a seat?
And planning on listening to some poems with me?
Why not? Why don't you read me your favorite one?
Oh, that's a tall order. I have so many favorites out of the stuff you got me, I'm not sure I could pick just one.

Fields.MenuText: In that case, I guess I won't be listening to any poems.
I understand. We did get you a lot of books.
Well, I don't have that much time, so I guess just pick a random one.

Fields.DialogueText: No, wait! I'll pick one, I'll pick one!
Yeah, and they're all so emotional. I mean, I definitely have favorites, but not a favorite favorite, you know?
A random one? I can't just flip to a random page and read off the first one I see.
If I had to pick one right now… I guess I'd go with Involuntary Spies. Do you know it?
I can't say I do.
Fantastic! You're going to love it!
It's been awfully quiet around here lately.
That's a good thing, isn't it?
Beside it being a little dull…yeah, it's good.
You sound like you have something you want to say. Feel free to speak your mind, I won't repeat it to anyone.

Fields.MenuText: No, this is war, I know we should be enjoying any peace we can get while we have it.
I'm just worried about crew morale. I feel like things have gotten less… exciting, maybe?
I'm kind of tired of Kitakami's poetry obsession. It's getting on my nerves.

Fields.DialogueText: You are correct, Kanchou. And it certainly is more peaceful now that our Belle has stopped her pranks.
It's true that outside of battle some of the crew has started to let their guard down and relax a little. I even saw one officer yawning.
I did warn you, didn't I?
You thought Kitakami's peaceful phase would pass, right? That the pranks would resume?
Plus you wouldn't have to deal with her trying to read you poetry all the time?
Is she doing the same with you?
Not as much as you, I'd guess. She knows I've already read most of it.
Good luck getting her away from those books, though. She hardly comes out of her room lately, and when she does it's only to read more in your office.
I thought she liked to eat with everyone.
She has a bit of a one-track mind. Once when she was into bird-watching, the ship would slow down whenever an eagle passed by. Totally obsessed with her hobby.
Bird-watching? I don't remember that.
It was long before you were kanchou. Before this war.
Wait… you mean before she was a Belle?
Yes. I've been an officer aboard her for quite some time.
*ALARM*
This is a conversation we're definitely going to finish later.
@BATTLE
Let's just say it wouldn't surprise me. How much are you dreading it?
Actually, I'm seeing the positive to them these days. They always kept everyone alert, and the atmosphere was a little more lively.
*ALARM*
Let's try again. "I'll fight Morganas like a warrior, I can't be..." I'll need to think more about this one.
@BATTLE
Just one more, then I'll go!
You've been saying that for the past hour! Come on.
I'm not even hungry!
What's going on here?
I'm just trying to get Kitakami out and about.
Has she really been that closed off from everyone else?
Just about. I think it's time for you to give this a shot. Maybe she'll listen to you.
Kitakami, it's the Captain.
I just got to the best part, Kanchou. I can't leave now!

Fields.MenuText: The poem will be there when you get back. The crew is starting to forget they even have a Belle.
You can bring the book with you. Just come on out.
Well… that's all I've got.

Fields.DialogueText: As if they'd ever forget about me!
I guess that would be okay…
That's all you've got?! Seriously?! You can't do anything else for me?
Hey, look - you're out.
Good work, Kanchou.
Let's go eat, I guess. And I can tell you all about this poem I'm reading.
Oh, joy.
I miss my parents.
Oh, you--
*ALARM*
I guess I won't comment.
@BATTLE
So, Kitakami, have you heard any news from your nation?
I don't know. Not really, I guess.
What do mean? How could you not know what's going on back home?
I don't know ‘cause it's not really that important. Is it?
It's just that usually during our meals, we'll chat about the situation back home.
That's so boring, though! Why talk about that when we could have an actual interesting conversation!?
But---
Pfft! Move on!

Fields.MenuText: It's her choice whether or not she wants to talk about her nation.
You really don't know what's happening back home?
Don't make faces at the table, Kitakami.

Fields.DialogueText: You're absolutely right, Kanchou! Take that! Kitakami wins!
Now you? Come on! It's so boring! Let's talk about music, or poetry, or something!
What face? This is just my normal face. Bleeeh! So is this. Heeeu! And this!
I'm sorry, Kitakami. If you don't want to talk about your home, then we don't have to.
That's more like it. But you got one thing wrong. My nation ain't my home. This is my home.
That's nice, Kitakami.
It's just how I feel.
Take two, "Kitakami is a great warrior, the worst opponents can do is annoy her!"
@BATTLE
Threats neutralized.
Another victory. Excellent work, everyone.
If this is the best the Morganas have, we'll have this war won in no time!
I like the confidence, but don't let one victory get to your head.
Hey, Kanchou, now that the fight's over, do you think you have a second?
For what?
Well, if I told you, I'm worried you wouldn't come.

Fields.MenuText: If you can't tell me, then I'm going to have to decline.
So it's like a surprise?
You've made me curious. I can spare a moment.

Fields.DialogueText: Ugh, don't be that way. We're just going to read some poetry together. Finally.
Yeah, and it's a good one too. It starts with a “P” and rhymes with oh-etry.
Fantastic! I've got the perfect poem for us to read together!
Poetry? Again?
What's with the face? You're gonna have fun, I promise. Come on!
Wait, Kitakami--
Kanchou! Don't make me drag you with me!
Never mind… We should speak later, Kanchou. When you're less… needed.
Kanchou, you've got to hear this new poem!
Another one?
You're going to love it, I swear! It's so powerful!
What's it called?
Lutany At Brink of Armageddon.

Fields.MenuText: That sounds rather… serious.
I'm guessing it's about sunshine and happy bunnies?
No, thank you. I'm in no mood to get sad and depressed right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it is. In this time of war, people are afraid.
Wait? Are you serious? You really don't get poetry, do you?
Oh, come on. It's art. The fact that it can affect your emotions is the beautiful part of it.
Why don't you give me a brief summary? What's it about?
Well… it's about all the craziness the world is going through.
Like evil Morganas from unknown origins and the spirits of ships coming to life?
Well, I'm not sure the author had those in mind specifically, but… It's so powerful that I just have to read it for you, then you'll understand!
*ALARM*
I don't think I need to hear it, Kitakami. I understand the craziness of the world right now. I'm living in the thick of it.
But it's still such a great poem!
@BATTLE
Is Kitakami starting to get on your nerves, Kanchou?
You're straight to the point!
I always am. I just want to make sure she isn't becoming a nuisance.

Fields.MenuText: Not a nuisance, really. I think I just miss the old Kitakami.
Honestly? I'm getting a little tired of all the poetry.
She's just more of a mystery to me. For one thing, I almost get the sense she's going out of her way not to seem like cares about Japan.

Fields.DialogueText: She's still the same Kitakami, this is just another side of her.
She really loves poetry. It's the only thing she'll read. I don't think she has the patience for anything else.
It's not that she doesn't care, it's just that it's not interesting enough for her.
I don't know. Have you noticed that the poetry she's going for seems to be almost exclusively Western?
Wait. "Another?"
One of your predecessors took issue with some of Kitakami's eccentricities.
I tried to explain how her mood affected her performance, but he wasn't having any of it.
This was… before she was a Belle, right?
Yes. He thought I was being ridiculous. He didn't understand that she actually enjoyed it when I read her poetry in the engine room, or that she liked watching the birds fly overhead.
I would've said you were projecting if I hadn't met her in human form.
Are you sure I wasn't?
*ALARM*
Morganas. We'll have to continue this conversation later.
Any time.
@BATTLE
I'm more worried about your state of mind. I don't want to lose another kanchou.
And that a lot of it involves themes that might alarm the Admirals back in Tokyo?
Is that a problem?
It's a problem if she's unhappy.
I think the fact that she feels safe to explore it all is keeping her from being unhappy, Kanchou.
*ALARM*
"Fight with Kitakami, you'll fight your last, and..." Oh bother, I'm in no mood.
@BATTLE
You know, I've been thinking.
That's never good. Should I hide the glue?
What's that supposed to mean?!
Usually when you spend a lot of time thinking, you're thinking about pranks to pull on the crew.
… While you're usually right, this time you're way off. I've got a great idea to improve the ship.
Well, since you are the ship, I'd love to hear it. What's your idea?
We need a farm.
I'm sorry. I must've misheard you. I thought you said "farm."
I did! We should seriously start a farm onboard the ship!

Fields.MenuText: There's no way that's going to happen. How would that even work?!
A farm? I can't say I don't like the idea.
Before I make any judgments, have you thought this through?

Fields.DialogueText: Well… we'd have… crops… and people growing those crops. And I guess we'd need fertilizer too… What else am I missing?
Exactly! Eating healthy is important, and if we grow our own food, it'd save us money at port! This is the best idea ever!
I totally have! We grow food and we eat it. What's to think about?
Where would this farm of yours be?
Uh… I guess on the deck?
And what happens when the Morganas shoot a couple holes into this farm?
Huh… Maybe I need to think about this a little bit first. Come back to me!
Hey, sailor! I just got a great idea for the ship - which, since I am the ship, makes sense!
Oh? I'm essentially obligated to hear it.
Indeed! So--
*ALARM*
Don't suppose that this is over!
@BATTLE
And you're sure the kanchou gave permission for all this?
Absolutely! This is going to be great!
Where *is* the kanchou? Isn't it strange that we're not having any supervision here at all?
Supervision with what, exactly?
Oh, you're here. Why are you here? I wasn't expecting you to be here.
I can see that. What's with the chairs and the podium?
Kitakami said you were going to host a poetry night every week.

Fields.MenuText: I never said anything like that.
… Of course she did.
A poetry night? We don't have the time or money to do something like this every week.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah… I know you didn't, but now that it's already set up, aren't you excited?!
See?! "Of course" are the key words there!
You have to think of it as an investment, Kanchou. By letting the crew express themselves, they'll be all the more ready to fight the Morgana threat!
I guess since everything is already set up, you can do it this one time. But just this once.
Yay! That's more than I expected, Kanchou! You're the best!
Hey, Kanchou, I've been wondering something for a while now.
You're not going to ask me something about poetry, are you?
Poetry isn't the only thing I think about, you know.
Then ask away.
What's your perspective on the war? What do you think about it?

Fields.MenuText: It's dangerous. We have to fight to stay alive.
It's exciting, this new threat… we don't know what to expect. It keeps your blood pumping.
It's like thinking about the weather - how you feel about it isn't as important as how you respond.

Fields.DialogueText: Staying alive is important…
You like fighting the Morganas? That's a little surprising.
Oh, come on. That's just being evasive.
What exactly are you getting at, Kitakami? What's going on in that head of yours?
When the war is over… When the Morganas have been wiped out. What's going to happen to us, to the Kami?
I don't know. If I'm still alive, I'll do everything in my power to see that you all have a say - but I don't have a crystal ball.
*ALARM*
Try not to think about the future too much. We need you in the present.
I know, Kanchou. I'm sorry.
@BATTLE
Hey, Kitakami, how are you doing?
I'm doing fine. Better now that you're here to read with me.
That's defintiely not why I'm here.
Sore wa omoshirokunai! What's going on, then?
I wanted to continue our conversation from earlier. About the future.
You mean about what will happen to the Kami after the Morganas have all been defeated?
Yeah, that conversation. What brought that on, anyway?
A poem I was reading. It talked about what happens after you die, where you go. I started thinking about where Kami would go, and if we'd go.
You think you'll die when the Morganas are defeated?
I think I might disappear. What do you think, though?

Fields.MenuText: I think that might be possible.
I don't think you'll be going anywhere. I won't allow it.
For all I know, all the Belles will combine into one giant Belle and rule over us as some sort of goddess.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's what's so troubling.
Hearing that from you means a lot to me. Thank you, Kanchou.
Well, you certainly have a creative imagination there.
I wish I had answers for you, Kitakami…
Me too, but we don't. It's just this uncertainty that's kinda getting to me right now.
There's not anything I can do to help, is there?
No. I'm just going to keep reading. Actually, you could join me - it might help a little.
… Okay, let's read some poetry.
Seriously!? Oh, this is going to be great, you're going to love this one poem I just read!
@BATTLE
"All that exists, for sure, is now, so to treasure it fully is my vow."
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
The mess hall is as quiet as it gets. Nothing to interrupt my reading.
The crew does look exhausted. They didn't start serving turkey for lunch, did they?
That's one explanation, though I doubt it's correct.
Hehe, okay, that was pretty great.
It's good to see a smile on your face, but what's so funny?
The table to your left, one of the officers fell asleep, face first in his food.

Fields.MenuText: I guess this is more serious than I thought.
Someone needed to catch up on their sleep.
Oh, hell.

Fields.DialogueText: It takes a man falling asleep in his potatoes for you to realize that?
I don't think it's because he was staying up late, Kanchou.
Indeed.
If you want the crew to get some energy back, the answer is right in front of you, Kitakami.
Kitakami, how would you---
*SNORE*
She fell asleep too?
We need to do something.
Kai, do you have a minute?
You sound serious. What's going on?
I think it's time you and I take Kitakami aside and talk to her about whatever's behind her recent behavior.
We know the "whatever." It's the poetry obsession.
Is it, though? She seems to be getting depressed.
And, honestly, it's not just her. Have you noticed the rest of the ship? The crew practically has zero energy outside of battle.
All the more reason we need to get Kitakami back to her old self.
Well, I may have been one step ahead of you.
What do you mean?
Let me show you something in my closet.
That's one of the weirder things I've heard you say. And you told me about how you talked to a ship!
Just look.
Whoa, what is-- Are all these…
All the poetry we got for Kitakami. Except for the book she's currently reading. But when she's done with that, she should start to get back to normal.

Fields.MenuText: In the future, check with me first before you steal things from the crew.
I really hope she doesn't end up killing you.
What if she finds them?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kanchou. My apologies.
Thank you, Kanchou.
I'm fairly certain that the last place she'll think to look is in my closet.
So what's the next step?
Nothing to do but wait for Kitakami to finish her last book. Without more poetry she'll get bored and go back to doing what she does best.
Here's hoping.
@BATTLE
... I know.
Uh-huh. I'm actually getting the sense that her mood may be making some of the crew's duties harder. Even basic stuff - stains are harder to remove, more small leaks are popping up...
You're telling me that, as her friend, you think stealing from her is going to improve her mood?
That... probably isn't the best way to put it.
But it's the only way I can think of to make her take a break and reconnect with the outside world. If we confront her, you know she's just going to dig in her heels.
Okay. Okay, we'll try it and see how she reacts. Just don't throw the books overboard without giving me a heads-up.
No, Kanchou.
And one more thing, Kai...
Think of it like impounding alcohol after a crew member has gone on a bender.
I wouldn't do that behind the crew member's back, though.
Does it count as going behind her back if we know she's going to figure it out, though?
Miss Kitakami, I was just pushing through some requisition orders, and thought I'd ask if you needed anything. Maybe something from home?
Why would I want anything from Japan?
I, uh, I don't know. It's just a chance to get something you miss or something special.
So my country's special? Is that it?
I, ummm…
Kanchou, is my country special?

Fields.MenuText: I'm a fan of it. They've got really good snack food.
That question's relative, really. Do you think it's special?
It's a place like any other. So no.

Fields.DialogueText: So snack food is what makes a place special?
It's just a place. I don't see what the big deal about it is.
Exactly. I can always trust you to see it my way.
Japan is just where I came from, but lots of people come from there, that doesn't make it special. Where I am is far more important.
You heard the lady, she doesn't want anything.
Right, my apologies.
Hopefully that's the last time that'll happen.
They're just trying to do something nice for you.
*ALARM*
If they want to do something nice, then they'll help get rid of this Morgana in record time. I was hoping to finish this book today.
I'm sure they'll do their best.
@BATTLE
*SLAM*
What's going on in here?
Where is it?! Under the chair? Uggggh, nope! And that is heavier than it looks. Maybe the bed!
Kitakami, calm down for a second. Why are you trashing your room?
I… My poetry. It's missing. I can't find it anywhere, Kanchou!
Really? That's… unfortunate.
Where could it be, Kanchou? All those books couldn't have just walked off on their own!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe we lost them in one of the Morgana attacks?
I have no idea… Maybe we should ask around.
Does it really matter? They're just books.

Fields.DialogueText: You think they might've gotten destroyed by a Morgana?! One more reason to hate those monsters.
I already tried asking Kai, but he was no help. Who else might know?
Just books?! “Just books” are things boring people read to learn stupid things. These are books of poetry. They're art!
Enough talk. We need to tear the ship apart and find them.
Oh, no. We're not doing anything until you stop for a minute and catch your breath.
*ALARM*
Do I still have to catch my breath?
As if we had time for that now.
@BATTLE
"Woe unto they who hinder art, as it makes appealing what is smart."
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Why'd you make me come down here? I'm not really hungry.
You have to eat.
It looks like a lot of the crew isn't hungry though. It's pretty empty in here.
It gets more quiet every day.
Hmmm… You know, Kitakami, maybe you should come up with some way to increase the energy levels around here.
Huh? Why me?
Well, you're definitely the most lively person on the ship.

Fields.MenuText: Plus it'll keep your mind off your missing books.
Nah, you're crazy. I don't think she could do this.
It's up to you whether you want to or not. I'm not going to order you or anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Ohhhh, now you've reminded me about them! Why'd you do that, Kanchou?!
Please, I could get the ship jumping again in a few seconds. It wouldn't take much at all.
Hmmm… Well, it could be fun, I suppose. A few pranks here, a few practical jokes there…
Okay, you know what, I've got this. I'm not going to let you down, Kanchou.
I'm sure you won't, Kitakami.
Excellent work, Kanchou. She's already looking more like herself.
Let's just hope she never finds out that you took her poetry.
That… would not be good.
Hey, Kanchou, why is it up to me?
Why is what up to you?
Why am I in charge of getting the crew's energy back up?

Fields.MenuText: Because you're to blame.
Because your energy is infectious.
Because they've been missing you and your energy.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm to blame?! How is this my fault?!
Heh, I guess it kind of is, isn't it? Thanks, Kanchou.
They've been missing me? But I've been right here.
You've been closed off with your poetry for a while, Kitakami. The crew didn't really get a lot of face time with you. I'm worried a few of them might've even forgotten about you.
You really think they might've forgotten about me?!
I hope not, but I'm not sure.
Well… they'll never forget me after I get done with them.
I may have pushed her too much there.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
"I'll turn these Morganas into wrecks, and Kai I will attend to next."
@BATTLE
Kai, have you seen Kitakami anywhere? I need to talk to her.
You just missed her.
Of course I did. You know where I can find her?
Nope.
Could you stand up and face me when you're talking to me?
I… can't remove my hands from this table.

Fields.MenuText: Was this some sort of arts and crafts accident?
She pulled a prank on you, didn't she?
We're going to have to remove them then. I'll grab some anesthetic. You're going to want to be out for this.

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly. Kitakami just got me good. I'm at least thankful she didn't use the rat.
Yup. She called me “Sticky-Fingers” before running out of here, laughing hysterically.
That really won't be necessary, I'm sure it will dissolve in time.
I hope you still think getting Kitakami back to normal was a good idea.
If you think this is bad, just wait until she starts messing with the rest of the crew.
*ALARM*
"A crucial battle is at hand. To arms, my crew, let's make a stand!"
@BATTLE
The Morganas have been defeated. Great work, everybody!
We really handed it to the Morganas this time! Come on, everybody, let's cheer!
*Cheers*
I don't think you were loud enough! Let's try one more time!
*Cheers*
That's more like it! Now let's cheer for the Kanchou!
*Cheers*
And three cheers for the farm we're gonna start on the deck!
*Cheers*

Fields.MenuText: That's not going to work, Kitakami.
Oh, come on, they don't even know what they're cheering for.
Stop cheering! And stop leading them like lemmings.

Fields.DialogueText: But look how much they want it!
They heard me clearly. They obviously want a farm, right?!
I'm just leading them where they want to go. To the farm!
*cheers*
So can we have a farm now? Pretty please?
It's going to take a lot more than a little cheering to convince me.
Now look at that! This is what I call an energetic crew.
Yeah, I know, right! Look at everyone laughing and having a good time!
I also notice quite a few officers gesturing toward you with angry expressions.
Oh, I'm sure you're misunderstanding. They're probably just weird-looking smiles.
What exactly have you been doing to the crew, Kitakami?
Oh, just this and that.
I'm going to need to know more than that.
Okay, well, I turned every pair of that officer's pants into shorts. He must've borrowed those pants from a friend.
That's a little much, but not horri--
I tickled that guy until he peed his pants.
… You what?
I filled her bed with scorpions!
That's definitely not okay!
They were fake!

Fields.MenuText: Excellent work, Kitakami. Keep it up.
Maybe tone it down a little.
Yup… This was a mistake.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Kanchou! See, the Kanchou approves, Kai!
So… I shouldn't make an itty bitty leak below deck?
I'm sorry, I couldn't hear you over the clamor of the crew.
Hearing about all this, it makes me glad I just had to deal with a little glue.
Hehehe, that was just the start. I've got plans.
You may be worse than the Morganas.
Oh, don't be a baby! You know you're having fun.
@BATTLE
Definitely not!
You're being serious?
Of course I'm being serious. You think I'd joke about something like this?!
I'm just having trouble believing it. Are you sure it wasn't a dream?
No, it wasn't a dream! I'd know if it was a dream… right?
Maybe I should just ask her myself and get to the bottom of this.
What's with all the arguing? I could hear you down the hall.
Sorry, Captain. I was just trying to convince my friend here that Kitakami talked to me about Japan.

Fields.MenuText: All good things, I hope.
Kitakami? The Belle? You're joking, right?
Is that weird or something?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, there were a number of---wait, why are you not shocked?!
Oh, come on, you don't believe me either?! It happened!
She's been avoiding the topic for as long as any of us can remember. So yes, it's weird!
I guess she's just opening up to everyone. It's about time if you ask me.
So this is serious? Man, I need to go find her and ask some questions!
@BATTLE
Update on the current top-secret mission to boost the crew's energy!
Nobody's died, right?
No, I toned down the hilarious pranks.
Oh, really? So what are you doing now?
I decided to tell them a little bit about Japan. They seemed so curious before, after all.

Fields.MenuText: I've noticed some of the crew amazed that you were opening up with them.
That's an interesting plan, and it seems to be working. Good job.
And you're okay with this? I don't want you to do anything you're not comfortable with.

Fields.DialogueText: My plan is working then. I knew it would.
Thank you, Kanchou. It's not as fun as my previous tactic, but the rest of the crew seems to approve, too.
I'm fine, Kanchou. It's a bit of a hassle, but I can handle a few questions.
Well, I better get back to it. Wish me luck.
Actually, before you go, I wanted to ask if you wanted some fresh--
Produce for the farm?! I knew you'd come around eventually! Thank you so much, Kanchou!
That's not what I meant. And she knows it.
@BATTLE
Sure is getting noisy around here again.
We can thank Kitakami for that.
I knew she'd pull it off. I don't think I've ever seen a crew this happy before.

Fields.MenuText: Has she pulled any more tricks on you?
I'm worried about what she's plotting. She's got to be planning some kind of huge prank.
Yeah, I'm honestly shocked she was able to pull this off so well.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, but that's normal for her.
Probably, but when isn't she?
Me too a little, but we should know by now that Kitakami can pull off anything she puts her mind to.
So I've been thinking of something to get her as a reward.
Kitakami mentioned that. Something about you getting her a farm.
She knows I'm not doing that. At most I'd just get the ship some fresh food. Fruit and the like.
She'll be happy. And we'd actually be able to afford it.
Unlike a farm on a warship.
Exactly.
@BATTLE
Kitakami, how are--
Is this about my farm?
No, I'm not getting you a farm and you know that.
Yeah, but you can't blame a Kami for trying.

Fields.MenuText: I can and I will.
I guess I can't, but it's not going to happen.
Why don't you put all your effort toward something more feasible?

Fields.DialogueText: Ahhh, don't be mad, I'm just joking around, you know that.
You say that now, but just you wait, I'll wear you down.
More feasible, huh? How about… Oh, I know, a ranch! We totally have enough room for that!
Seriously though, Kanchou. I'm sorry if I've been a little bit all over the place.
What do you mean?
I know about the poetry.
You mean about how they mysteriously disappeared and no one knows where they ended up?
I mean how they mysteriously migrated into Kai's closet. I found them while I was hiding the rat.
The rat?
That's not the important part. I talked to Kai - well, interrogated him - and he made me realize that I really did get a little too wrapped up in my own emotions.
Maybe a little. But it's a good thing that you're so in touch with your emotional side.
Maybe, but that doesn't mean I can ignore the rest of the ship, so I'm sorry. And I won't let it happen again.
I'm the one who should be sorry, I shouldn't have let Kai steal your books.
Oh, he's already paying for that. I wouldn't expect to see him for a few days.
That's ominous…
Oh, it's all in good fun! We're all friends here!
